00019 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00020 {
00021         
00022         
00023         //here are the values that are needed during the program, but which 
00024         //may be altered at run-time by user input.
00025         Int_t numSubFiles = 20;
00026         cout << "There are " << argc << " arguments" << endl;
00027         //read in the arguements supplied by the user
00028         Int_t i = 1;
00029         while(i < argc-2) {
00030                 
00031                 if(strcmp(argv[i],"-n") == 0){
00032                         numSubFiles = atoi(argv[++i]);
00033                 }
00034                 
00035                 else {
00036                         cout << "Invalid option: " << argv[i] << "... exiting" << endl;
00037                         exit(0);
00038                 }
00039         
00040         i++;
00041         }
00042         
00043         TString fInFileName(argv[argc-2]);
00044         TString fOutDir(argv[argc-1]);
00045         if(!fOutDir.EndsWith("/")) fOutDir += "/";
00046         
00047         //spit out the command to std out so the user knows the program read in the proper
00048         TDatime now;
00049         cout << now.AsSQLString() << ": ";
00050         i = 0;
00051         while(i < argc){
00052                 cout << " " << argv[i++];
00053         }
00054         cout << endl << endl;
00055         cout << "Intput File: " << fInFileName << endl;
00056         cout << "Output Dir:  " << fOutDir << endl;
00057         
00058         
00059         
00060         //Now on to the work - read in the file and check for HLA Event.
00061         //In the future, it should be possible, via polymorphism, to 
00062         //to handle raw and hla events. 
00063         
00064         KDataReader fin(fInFileName.Data());
00065         KHLAEvent *fEventIn = dynamic_cast<KHLAEvent *>(fin.GetEvent());
00066         if(fEventIn == 0){
00067                 cout << "Not an HLA File" << endl;
00068                 return -1;
00069         }
00070         
00071         KDataWriter *fout = 0;
00072         KHLAEvent *fEventOut = 0;
00073         
00074         if(fInFileName.EndsWith(".root")){
00075                 fInFileName.Remove(fInFileName.Length() - 5, 5);  //strip the .root off"
00076         }
00077         else {
00078                 cout << "Input File Name does not end in .root" << endl;
00079                 return -1;
00080         }
00081                  
00082         Int_t fBreakAfterThisNumEvents = fin.GetEntries()/numSubFiles;
00083         cout << "There will be " << fBreakAfterThisNumEvents << " events per sub file." << endl;
00084         cout << "There will be " << numSubFiles << " sub files." << endl;
00085         
00086         Int_t subFileCounter = 0;
00087         
00088         for(Int_t i = 0; i < fin.GetEntries(); i++){
00089                 
00090                 if(i % fBreakAfterThisNumEvents == 0 && i!=0){
00091                         if(fout != 0){
00092                                 cout << "Writing and Closing sub file." << endl;
00093                                 fout->Write();
00094                                 fout->Close();
00095                                 delete fout; fout = 0;
00096                         }
00097                         
00098                         TString fOutName = fOutDir + fInFileName + "_"; fOutName +=subFileCounter++;
00099                         fOutName += ".root";
00100                         
00101                         cout << "Opening " << fOutName << endl;
00102                         
00103                         fout = new KDataWriter(fOutName.Data());
00104                         fEventOut = dynamic_cast<KHLAEvent *> (fout->GetEvent());
00105                         if(fEventOut == 0){
00106                                 cout << "Hmmmm KDataWriter gave me the wrong event type" << endl;
00107                                 return -1;
00108                         }
00109                         
00110                 }
00111                 
00112                 fEventOut->Clear();
00113                 fin.GetEntry(i);
00114                 *fEventOut = *fEventIn;
00115                 
00116                 fout->Fill();
00117                 
00118                 /*
00119                 Int_t ObjectNumber = TProcessID::GetObjectCount();
00120                 
00121                 //Restore Object count                                                                                                     
00122                 //To save space in the table keeping track of all referenced objects 
00123                 //and computation time,
00124                 //we assume that our events DO NOT address each other. We reset the                                                        
00125                 //object count to what it was at the beginning of the event.

00127                 
00128         }
00129

00132                 fout->Write();
00133                 fout->Close();

00136         
00137         fin.Close();
